class_notes: This course provides an introduction to the political, cultural, social and economic history of Latin America and the Caribbean from the Aztec and Inca empires through the twenty-first century. While attempting an overview of the region's history, the course will explore an answer to the question "What is Latin America?" and will focus on the diversity as well as the common histories that have shaped the region.  Moving between macro-processes of empire building, capital formation, enslavement and revolution and smaller-scale events in the social, cultural, racial and economic life of the region, the course will highlight the unity and diversity of the place (s) we call "Latin America."
course_description: This course explores the history of Latin America from European contact to present. Major themes include Latin America's position in a wider world; class, ethnic, and race relations; state-society relations; the making of regional and national identities.
